info.content: Went to the White Hart with Laura and the Boys. The famous "Barrie Raffle Ticket" incident. We all got really drunk. Barrie hadn't realized he'd won the raffle. When he did he argued with the bouncer, and said, 'I know you are a chain, I've seen loads of White Hart's. I'm gonna call your head offices and complain'. Cracking night.

title.value: White Hart - New Years Eve Party

info.content: Laura and I went to see the A Long Kiss Goodnight. We both enjoyed that one. The film was cut short of the last 10 seconds. the film melted! We all got free tickets to see another film. Great!
Went to Helen's student house in Cardiff. Went to the student union bar and then on to some bars.

Laura had passed her nursing exams! Hooray. I turned my room into a romantic restaurant with one candle-lit table for 2. On the menu was Cheese Strata. I gave Laura the Evita CD as a present and bought surprise tickets for the night’s performance of the Bootleg Beatles.

The Bootleg Beatles were performing down at the BIC. It was great to see so many people there and the bootleggers were great. They performed roughly in chronological order, dressing up in various outfits they wore at the time. It was a weird concert. There were seats as if it were a school assembly, in this massive hall. Still we both enjoyed it allot.
Went to Robins and saw First Wives Club.

We went to the big bonfire and fireworks display at Blackheath. We followed loads of people from Lee Green to Blackheath. I won a deformed bee for Laura at the fair. We had Lau's house to ourselves for the weekend which was nice.

Laura and I went ice skating at Guildford Spectrum. I'm not that great.

We also went to see the Nutty Professor at Robins.

For my 21st birthday, Mum and Dad got me a race experience at Thruxton. A driven lap in a Rover then a go myself in a single seater race car. I remember not doing great and found it hard to get track position.

Racing at Thruxton

Martin the race driver

Start of my fourth and final year.

Lived at: 350 Charminster Road, Charminster, Bournemouth, BH8 9RX - Above a then Malaysian Restaurant

Lived with Andy Ohme, Renaud Docquier and Gilbert White

Moved into my room above a restaurant in Charminster
We went on Gerry's boat, Babar, for the day.

Dad and I had planned a surprise trip to Copenhagen. Although it was for Dad's 50th birthday I was surprising Mum and Mormor really. Susan and Gary were already out there.

Martin, Mormor and Susan

Carlsberg Elephants

Enjoying some Carlsberg

Games at Lise and Jorgen's summer house

On the Copenhagen Canal cruise with Lise and Jorgen
Went to London for the day.

Remember getting up really early and drove up with Steve to London. Caught a coach from somewhere like Liverpool Street station and being one of the first to arrive at Knebworth. Both inexperienced concert goers, we were the first on site. We had the chance of going right next to the stage, but decided for some reason to go into pit 2. It was amazing. I remember the lineup for today being:

  • Bootleg Beatles
  • Manic Street Preachers
  • Ocean Colour Scene
  • Chemical Brothers
  • 1. The Swamp Song
  • 2. Columbia
  • 3. Acquiesce
  • 4. Supersonic
  • 5. Hello
  • 6. Some Might Say
  • 7. Roll With It
  • 8. Slide Away
  • 9. Morning Glory
  • 10. Round Are Way
  • 11. Cigarettes and Alcohol
  • 12. Whatever
  • 13. Cast No Shadow
  • 14. Wonderwall
  • 15. The Masterplan
  • 16. Don't Look Back In Anger
  • 17. My Big Mouth
  • 18. It's Gettin' Better (Man!!)
  • 19. Live Forever
  • Encore
  • 1. Champagne Supernova
  • 2. I Am The Walrus

Oasis Ticket

Oasis Wristband
Can't say I was unhappy to leave. For the last couple of months I was the only student to be working. Needed the money.

title.value: Finished Work At Southampton Oceanography Centre

info.content: Went with Dan Snell to the Oval to watch the NatWest quatre final between Surrey, my county and Somerset, Dan's county. We drank beer!

We went to Southend for the day as I had never been. It was a bit sludgey on the beach.

Southend mud!
Went to Canterbury to look around the town.

As a belated birthday present Laura took me to see Grease at the Dominion theatre. This was the first time I had been to the theatre and I remembered I was absolutely bowled over with the auditorium when I first walked in. I absolutely loved the atmosphere and the whole theatre thing. It was a real show.

Grease programme

Grease ticket

Laura and I went to see Mission Impossible at Camberley Cinema. We both liked the film.

Mission Impossible ticket
Went with the Weston family to the Leicester Square and ate at Planet Hollywood.
I was invited around to Steve's house for Ellie's 18th birthday family party. Of course I met up with Laura.

At the tennis

At the tennis

At the tennis
Laura off to Phil and Emma's wedding

Dad managed to get tickets for the FA Cup final. This year I went with Steve. Saw Cantona score a cracking goal to sink Liverpool.

1996 FA Cup Final Ticket

1996 FA Cup Final Lineups

title.value: FA Cup Final - Man U v Liverpool

info.content: Looking rough on the boat

Claire Joyce managed to get me a placement down with her and Dan Snell at Southampton Oceanography Centre. This was such a laid back place. You could get away with doing nothing for days on end. There was very little help or guidance.

My job involved writing C++ on Unix, using widgets from a third party company. Trouble was that move Dan and Claire were no better than me at C++, so I made slow progress.

My salary £612 a month. This journey also took an hour, although there were a lot more miles than High Wycombe.

title.value: Start with at Southampton Oceanography Centre

info.content:
Having failed a second essay, Laura is now off the course until at least the start of next year. It's a bit of a shame as her career is on hold for 9 months basically.

In the meantime she has started working as a Nursery assistant at Meopham School with children aged between 3 months to 5 years old.

We were at home and I got into my car with Dad. I was chatting to him and without really concentrating I reversed up the drive way and CRASH. Straight into Gary's car. Gary needed the two front wings, a bonnet and a bumper replacing. Fortunately there was no damage to my car so I didn't have to pay any excess! Gary's Dad was not best pleased and rang me constantly pressuring me to pay up without going through the insurance.
Unfortunately Armstrong's. Really sad day for the whole company. I've not completed enough weeks for university. I think I am 4 weeks short.

We met up after work and went first to the Museum of Moving Images, close to the South Bank. Then went on to Topo Gigio restaurant in Soho. A really special night. I saw Laura off from Victoria station.

First we went to the Museum Of Moving Images

The bill

Sherringham, Armstrong, Campbell 2, 32,852. A shocking nights work! 4-1 score line.

Laura took Martin to White Hart Lane to see Man Utd lose 4-1 to Tottenham.
